summary: February 3 is the 34th day of the year in the Gregorian calendar.
full_text: William David Coolidge  was an American physicist and engineer, who made major contributions to X-ray machines. He was the director of the General Electric Research Laboratory and a vice-president of the corporation. He was also famous for the development of "ductile tungsten", which is important for the incandescent light bulb.
title: William D. Coolidge
